docna.cdata!:
Malawi - Second Technical Assistance Project
            : Credit 1428 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Malawi - Second Technical
            Assistance Project : Credit 1428 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The project supports the related
            structural adjustment credit and aims at assisting the
            Government in achieving its goals of improved energy
            planning and coordination.  It also aims to substantially
            reduce the country's consumption of fuelwood, improve
            its pricing of power and industrial commodities, strengthen
            the debt and financial management capabilities of the
            Ministry of Finance and the Agricultural Development and
            Marketing Corporation (ADMARC) and carry out its structural
            adjustment program.  Specifically, the three year project
            would finance:  (a) an energy economist/planner, consultant
            services for a power tariff study, in-service and overseas
            training and office supplies for the newly established
            Energy Unit in the Economic Planning Division;   (b)
            vehicles, operating expenses and engineering and consulting
            services for a pilot fuelwood savings program for the
            Tobacco Research Authority; (c) consultant services to
            examine price controls for industrial commodities; (d) a
            financial controller and financial analyst to be seconded to
            ADMARC;  (e) consultant support, equipment and in-service
            training for the Debt Management Unit of the Ministry of
            Finance; and (f) consultant services for other studies
            needed to carry out the structural adjustment program.
